name: Snowdon via Llanberis Path
description: The most popular and 'easiest' route up Snowdon. Follows the railway track. Still a proper mountain - don't underestimate. Summit café when train running.

name: Snowdon via Pyg Track
description: More dramatic than Llanberis with better views. Rocky sections require hands. Starts from Pen-y-Pass - arrive early or take Sherpa bus. Joins Miners' at Glaslyn.

name: Snowdon via Miners Track
description: Scenic route past Llyn Llydaw and Glaslyn. Easier than Pyg until final steep section to join Llanberis path. Historic mining remains.

name: Crib Goch
description: Grade 1 scramble along knife-edge ridge. Genuinely dangerous in wind/wet/ice. People die here. Do not attempt unless experienced scrambler with head for heights. Spectacular but serious.

name: Tryfan North Ridge
description: Classic Grade 1 scramble up iconic peak. Hands required throughout. Jump between Adam and Eve rocks on summit (optional and exposed). Descent via South Ridge or Heather Terrace.

name: Pen y Fan
description: Highest peak in South Wales. Multiple routes - Storey Arms most popular but eroded. Pont ar Daf adds loop via Corn Du. Get there early on weekends.

name: Horseshoe Ridge
description: Classic Beacons horseshoe taking in Pen y Fan, Corn Du, Cribyn, and Fan y Big. Long day but quieter than just Pen y Fan. Navigation skills needed in mist.

name: Cadair Idris via Pony Path
description: Classic route up 'Chair of Idris'. Legend says sleep on summit and wake poet or mad. Steep in places but well-maintained. Llyn Cau cirque spectacular.

name: Cadair Idris via Minffordd
description: More dramatic route via Llyn Cau. Steeper and rougher than Pony Path. The view down to the lake from the rim is breathtaking.

name: Worm's Head
description: Iconic tidal island. CHECK TIDE TIMES - 2.5 hour window either side of low tide. Coastguard posts times. People get stranded every year. Seals on rocks.

name: Pembrokeshire Coast Path
description: 186-mile National Trail. Do it all or pick sections. St Davids to Solva is classic day. Whole path is bucket-list. Accommodation needs booking in summer.

name: South Stack Cliffs
description: RSPB reserve with 4000 breeding seabirds. Puffins April-July. 400 steps down to lighthouse (and back up). Stunning coastal scenery.

name: Sychnant Pass to Conwy
description: Ancient route over the pass with views to Snowdonia and coast. Can extend to Conwy Mountain. Connects to North Wales Path.

name: Watkin Path
description: Starts from Nant Gwynant. Passes Gladstone Rock where he spoke aged 83. Upper section is steep scramble. Views down Cwm Llan are spectacular.

name: Moel Siabod
description: Underrated peak with 360° views of Snowdon Horseshoe. Less crowded than the big names. Boggy approach but worth it. Capel Curig start.
